commit.message:
feat: Add Vagrant script (#24)

* feat: Add Vagrant

* More configuration

Configure Virtual Box
Install Docker
Install Docker-Compose
Setup SocketCAN

* Remove Vagrantfile

* gitignore Vagrantfile

* Add default vagrant env

* Add Sample Vagrantfile

* Add bash script for setting up Vagrant Stuff

* Add emulation start scripts

* Add docs

* Pull out set_default_env into function

* README

* Update .gitignore

* Print help on bad input

* Provide full paths to vagrant dir

* Fix bad docs

changed Vagrantfile to point to ruby 2 base box
made importer more resilient to bad input data (i.e., missing company data)
importer now logs more data upon exception
importer now skips records that lack a category code
added crunchbase_id to FundingRound model, to be used as unique identifier
added raw_raised_amount field to funding_rounds, convert raised_amount data from api to raw_raised_amount in importer
added method to funding_round called raised_amount to return the raw_raised_amount if units are in USD, else 0, and added tests

gdal: Autospec creation for update from version 3.6.4 to version 3.7.0

Even Rouault (1073):
      Tag master as 3.7.0dev
      BUILDING.md: update status of build systems [ci skip]
      NITF: fix heap-buffer-overflow on corrupted images (introduced in 3.6.0). Fixes https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/detail?id=53006
      Doc: add man page for ogr_layer_algebra
      GRIB2: fix crash and invalid metadata when processing index .idx file with sub-messages (fixes #6613)
      OGRMergeGeometryTypesEx(): do not consider different type of MultiGeometries (ie MultiPoint, MultiLineString, MultiPolygon) as being mergeable as GeometryCollections. Affect GML driver (fixes #6616)
      swig/include/gdal.i: fix GDT_TypeCount value (affects C# and Java bindings)
      Doc: ot.rst: advertize UInt64 and Int64
      HDF5 multidim: fix crash on 'gdalmdiminfo HDF5:autotest/gdrivers/data/netcdf/alldatatypes.nc'
      GPKG: add compatibility with GPKG 1.0 gpkg_data_column_constraints table
      Add missing #include <algorithm> for std::min/std::max uses, and #include <limits> for std::numeric_limits<>
      cppcheck fixes
      docker/alpine-normal: update dependencies, add libjxl and libkml deps [ci skip]
      typo fixes
      NEWS.md: update for 3.6.0rc2
      Make it possible to specify all HTTP related configuration options as path-specific options with VSISetPathSpecificOption()
      Add RFC 87: Signed int8 data type for raster
      Doc: advertize @gdal@mastodon.social
      Internal libtiff: resync with upstream
      autotest: make test pass on a minimal build (fixes #6327)
      GPKG raster: implement setting the nodata value for Byte dataset (fixes #1569)
      VDV: remove hack that broke with GPKG enhancement in following commit
      GPKG: add support for reading tables with generated columns (fixes #6638)
      Fix build with -DOGR_ENABLE_DRIVER_GML=OFF (fixes #6647)
      Doc: advertize FOSS4G 2023 Prizren
      commit forgotten doc/images/foss4g2023.png
      tif_jxl.c: use re-entrant error functions of libtiff master
      OpenFileGDB: do not use buggy .spx spatial index found in some datasets (fixes geopandas/geopandas#2253)
      [lint] overview.cpp: rename GDALResampleChunk32R_Average to GDALResampleChunk32R_AverageOrRMS
      netCDF: fix exposiing geotransform when there's x,y and lat,lon coordinates and the CRS is retrieved from crs_wkt attribute (fixes #6656)
      HDF5: fix build with libhdf5 1.13.2 and 1.13.3 (fixes #6657)
      gdaldataset: fix false-positive gcc 12.2.1 -O2 warning about truncation of buffer
      LIBKML: fix likely null pointer dereference false-positive warnings of gcc 12.2.1 -O2
      CI: update alpine to edge
      Doc: gml.rst: point at gfs.xsd
      gfs.xsd: add Curve and Surface as valid geometry types
      Doc: advertize v3.6.0
      docker/README.md: advertize 3.6.0 images
      HDF4: fix opening more than 32 simultaneous HDF4_EOS files (fixes #6665)
      CPLGetUsablePhysicalRAM(): take into account RSS limit (ulimit -m) (fixes #6669)
      CPLGetNumCPUs(): take into sched_getaffinity() (fixes #6669)
      CMake: remove RECOMMENDED flag to BRUNSLI and QB3. Add it for CURL (refs https://github.com/spack/spack/pull/33856#issue-1446090634)
      Add autotest/cpp/gdallimits and test it in CI (refs #6669)
      configure.cmake: fix wrong detection of pread64 for iOS (adapted from patch by Nik Sands)
      typo fixes [ci skip]
      Doc: download.rst: mention Spack
      FindSQLite3.cmake: add logic to invalidate SQLite3_HAS_ variables if the library changes
      CMake: detect if sqlite3 is missing mutex support
      Fix build when sqlite3_progress_handler() is missing
      CMake: do not use Armadillo if it lacks LAPACK support (such as on Alpine)
      GPKG: avoid nullptr dereference on corrupted databases
      validate_gpkg.py: make it work with SRID=-1 in geometry blobs
      GPKG: fix bad performance of ST_Transform() by caching the OGRCoordinateTransformation object
      GeoJSON: fix transmission of 'Accept: text/plain, application/json' header when reading from http:// resource (3.6.0 regression)
      VSIGSFSHandler::UnlinkBatch(): avoid potential nullptr deref (master only, CID 1500607)
      GPKG: add a SetSRID() SQL function
      ogrmerge.py: add optimization for GPKG -> GPKG non-single layer case
      SQLite/GPKG: move PRELUDE_STATEMENTS evaluation just after database opening
      [Doc] software_using_gdal.rst: mention https://gdal3.js.org
      CMake: make it possible to build on Linux if linux/fs.h is missing by explicitly setting ACCEPT_MISSING_LINUX_FS_HEADER

      PCIDSK: advertize missing capabilities
      autotest: fix PytestReturnNotNoneWarning deprecation warning (fixes #6644)
      Python bindings: add a 'python_generated_files' target that facilitate generation of bindings without building the lib
      WFS/CSW: do not remove single or double quote character in a LIKE filter
      RFC87: change status and add voting history
      Add GDT_Int8 support (RFC 87)
      RFC87: change status to implemented
      typo fixes
      Add RFC88 text: Use GoogleTest framework for C/C++ unit tests

      /vsigs/ allow GDAL_HTTP_HEADERS config option to be used as authentication method if contains at least a line starting with "Authorization:"

      SWIG: add gdal.GetNumCPUs() and gdal.GetUsablePhysicalRAM()
      gpkg.py: make test 51 conditioned by value of gdal.CPLGetUsablePhysicalRAM()
      SOSI: do not advertize GDAL_DCAP_CREATE_FIELD as it is not implemented
      VDV: make creation of temporary .gpkg files more robust on some platforms
      GPKG: GetNextArrowArray(): recycle worker threads instead of recreating them
      OGRArrowArrayHelper::SetDate(): simplify implementation
      bench_ogr_batch & bench_ogr_c_api: make it possible to specify layer name
      Add WKBFromEWKB() for a slightly faster OGRGeometryFromEWKB()
      GTiff: DISCARD_LSB: reduce range of validity to [0,7] for Byte to avoid unsigned integer overflow if 8. Fixes https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/detail?id=53570
      CPLGetExecPath(): add MacOSX and FreeBSD implementations; prevent potential one-byte overflow on Linux&Windows
      S3: fix issue with EC2 IDMSv2 request failing inside Docker container with default networking
      Avoid Coverity Scan false positives
      CSV: accept comma as decimal separator in X_POSSIBLE_NAMES, Y_POSSIBLE_NAMES and Z_POSSIBLE_NAMES fields
      GTiff: if CRS is DerivedProjected, write it to PAM .aux.xml file (fixes #6758)
      /vsiaz/: make AppendBlob operation compatible of Azurite (fixes #6759)
      PG: avoid error when inserting single feature of FID 0 (fixes #6728)

      GDALNoDataValuesMaskBand::IReadBlock(): avoid int overflow on blocks > 2 GB
      autotest: avoid failures on missing drivers
      COG or multi-threaded GTiff generation: fix propagation of extra samples/alpha info that affects JXL compression
      TIFF JXL: add a JXL_ALPHA_DISTANCE creation option
      JPEGXL: add a ALPHA_DISTANCE creation option
      Doc: improve explanations about JXL_DISTANCE
      test_ogrinfo_lib.py: use @pytest.mark.require_driver()
      autotest/conftest.py: include driver name in skip reason of @pytest.mark.require_driver()
      typo fixes [ci skip]
      autotest/utilities: use pytest.mark.require_driver() (refs #4487)
      pyscripts/utilities: use pytest.mark.require_driver() (refs #4487)
      CMake: support the 'cmake --install x --prefix y' syntax (with caveat noted in doc) (fixes #7275)

      osr_basic_subprocess.py: fix test failure with sqlite 3.41

      autotest/ogr: use pytest.mark.require_driver() (refs #4487)
      docker/util.sh: fix issue when building arm64 Ubuntu images [ci skip]
      CSVSplitLine(): do not treat in a special way double quotes that appear in the middle of a field

      delaunay.c: avoid clang -Wdocumentation warning

      vrtsourcedrasterband.cpp: avoid Coverity Scan warning
      FindCryptoPP.cmake: properly take into account _LIBRARY_RELEASE/_DEBUG (fixes #7338)

      GPKG: implement loading/saving band statistics in GPKG metadata tables or PAM .aux.xml
      GDALDataset::CopyLayer(): copy source layer metadata, unless the COPY_MD=NO option is specified

      Update doc/source/drivers/raster/openfilegdb.rst
      Update autotest/gdrivers/openfilegdb.py
      COG: relax a bit the tolerance when computing tile number (fine tune 6310c1aecb3b31365fb36daedf064b3aaf3884ca)

      OGRUnionLayer::GetExtent(): do not emit error on no-geometry layer

      RawRasterBand::FlushCache(): avoid crash in some situations

Release 0.1.dev48

-Initial Setup for Later Work:
  - Include a current copy of the Ansible system we've been using
  - Replace some Ansible configs
  - Include a `requirements.txt` file
  - Create context managers that work with virtualenvwrapper and bash
  - Added Documentation
  - Use `@task` to identify FAB tasks
  - Cleaned up some of the functionality re: ansible setup
  - Rename deploy.py to setup.py
    -- Also, fixed some documentation
  - Edited README.md and added `enable_git_repo` task
    -- Does not use `git clone` for now, just does `git init` and `git remote add origin ...`
    -- Minor wording fix in README.md
  - Create `django_project` template, and recursive modify function
    -- Added function that fills in the blanks of a 'template directory' recursively
  - django_project "Directory template" fixed to work nicely with recursive file mod function
  - Cleanup some code (python 3 compatible `print`)
  - Purged the last of "%s" % "example-string" menace
  - Lots of minor fixes
  - Remove 'nevercache_key'
  - Added `s` to template wrappers
-Feature #3: VirtualEnv Shortcuts
  - Unrelated fixes:
    -- Completely remove `nevercache_key` from orchestration files
  - Added commands to `setup_virtualenv.yml` so we start using virtualenvwrapper
  - Enabled Vagrant deployment flow
  - Update README.md
- Change Vagrant synced-folder type from "rsync" to "virtualbox"
  - "rsync" was too glitchy and weird
  - "virtualbox" was what we were using before
- Feature 16: Yurt pre-fills the `settings.DATABASE` configs
- Fix issue/ bad gunicorn template
- Add `private_application_hosts`
- Move `settings.DATABASE` to `base.py`
- Implement `os.getenv`
- Fixes #15
- Fix Issue with `vagrant.secret_key`
- Feature 11: Preload Variables and other stuff
- Variables like `secret_key` and `db_password` are generated randomly and inserted in `fabric_settings.py`
- Generate PEM-file to put in servers
- Create functions in `utils.py` for generating random chars and SSH-keypairs
- Hook PEM-key creation into `fab setup.new` call process
- Post Code Review:
  - Best practice change: `generate_ssh_keypair` always returns 2 str tuple
- Feature #19: SSH-keys copied over automagically
- Confirms user to add ssh public key to on server
- Interactive menu for project environments
- Make backing up `fabric_settings.py` an option (for people like me)
- Feature 6: Finalize existing project setup.
- Sets up an existing project with local installation
- Fix issue with project directory mounted to `/vagrant` and not `/vagrant/<proj_name>`
- Added more documentation
- Move all utility functions to same file
- Fix some documentation
- Simplify existing project dev environment setup:
- have `git_repo` be a `raw_input`
- derive `project_name` from `git_repo`
- Have $FAB_PATH be added before running the rest of `setup.existing`
- have system add "." to PYTHONPATH if `fabric_settings` doesn't import
- escape backticks (`) and double-quotes (") along with single-quotes(') when generating keys and PWs
- make PEM-flow optional
- Fix context manager in fab setup.existing
- Use correct method for removing `.git` from name
- Create `sudo` context manager
- Utilize `_sudo` api, remove `sudo` context manager
- Include "sudo" in call for ansible-galaxy installation
- Upgrade to creating Python3 Projects
- Also, updating Ansible to be current
- Use pip3 instead of regular pip
- Many, many tweaks to get this to run all the way
- Moar tweaks: fixing project names with "-"
- No special chars in database passwords
- Refactor getting project name from git repo
- Fix virtualenvwrapper stuff
- Fix spacing
- Give user option to update nodesource or not
- Update README.md
- Change date and Python version
- Update README.md
- Re-specified which Python versions are working.
- Misc. Fixes:
- Change src. and dest. of synced folder in VM
- Add `vagrant install vbguest` to flow
- Remove `__author__="deanmercado"` from __init__.py
- Hotfix: Remove weirdness that was carelessly added
- YURT26: Add `MEDIA_ROOT` and `MEDIA_URL`
- YURT28: Fix Vagrantfile synced folder src and dest
- YURT30: Add step in orchestration that fixes virtualenvs permissions
- YURT27: Remove dependency installation and setup from flow (and add to readme)
- Remove virtualenvwrapper requirement, add ansible requirement
- Fix root-level requirements.txt
- Fix to config/base.py
- Have the "NEW project" flow run `vagrant up`
- README.md has less subsections now
- Remove more bad characters from list of printable strings
- Add more to `Troubleshooting` section of README.md
- Fixed gunicorn template
- Add-able Remote Servers
- Remove the extra environments from the `fabric_settings.py` form
- Wrote new `add` module that handles adding new things to a remote environment
- Make it entirely command-line input
- Remove debugging bits
- [YURT-36] FAB_PATH breaking
- [YURT-38] Auto-generated Server Project Path Incorrect
- [YURT-34] Sudo in symlink not needed
- [YURT-39] User feedback on user deployment setup
- Use Ansible variable `bashrc_path`
- Remove `Export PROJECT_HOME` task from app.tasks (not needed at all)
- Add newline in Nginx config file
- Add instructions in README.md for adding remote deployment target
- Fix prompts on `add.remote_server` flow
- Fix error with `copy_pem_file`
- Fix issues with create_pem_file
- Added new flows to README.md
- Remove `fabric_settings.py` requirement from PEM operations
- Clarify `<environment>` description in  README.md
- Revise Deploy script to also be interactive and easy to use!
- Update README.md with instructions for new feature use
- Python3ify the `print` statements
- Enable shortcut thru `fab deploy` prompts by enabling flag on fab call
- Additionally: Print message and escape if user is not in the right repo
- Additionally: Include `sudo` program in list of programs to `apt-get`
- Implement Hashicorp Vault (Closes #43)
- VAULT-44: Create `add.vault` Fab method (Closes #44)
- VAULT-45: Add remote server flow (Closes #45)
- VAULT-46: Add lookup-module for HVAC (Closes #46)
- YURT-49: Put the pieces in place to make Yurt a pip package AND CLI Tool
- Remove extra dependencies
- More tweaking for packaging (non-functional)
- More adjustments to setup.py
- Move `yurt.py`
- Fixed issues with packaging, refactored paths in `fabfile/setup.py`
- Refactor paths in `fabfile/add.py`
- Add stuff to `.gitignore`
- Remove argument from `new` submethod and update version
- Re-enable templating
- Add context argument to `new_projects`
- Fix `create_project` command
- Remove `main.command` decorator from `load_orchestration...`
- Move `requirements` to base directory
- Put settings setup in function, make `SETTINGS` lowercase
- Remove `executable` parameter from `pip` module call
- Fix naming conflict
- Clean up bad `pip` call
- Add `deploy` to yurt methods
- Closes #49
- Change date on README.rst
- Add setup step in README.rst
- Includes vault-stuff (prematurely)
- Reinclude ansible.cfg
- Fixed vault ops
- Delete `README.md`
- Enable Vaultified Git Keys
- Remove references to "Fabric" calls
- Enforce vaults being saved in the right place
- Closes #48
- Removes quotes from priv/pub key in base.yml
- Fixes #9: Autoinstall Grappelli
- Cleanup dependencies, enable ad-hoc calls for debugging
- Fixes #51: Adds `--dest` flag to vault, overrides needing Vagrantfile
- Fixes #52: Create method that automatically searches for Vagrantfile
- Fixes #53: Update setup instructions in README.rst
- Remove `$` from snippets in README.rst
- Add some notes on Vagrant usage to README.rst
- Make using `yurt remote_server` more flexible (can be called from anywhere in project)
- Fix some weirdness with file naming
- Build `roles_path` into project `ansible.cfg`
- Code Review: Add "`" to a print message
- Code Review: Fix indentation
- Code Review: Refactor some vault stuff in another method
- Fix `yurt add_settings --vault` flow

Changes also aligned with latest from meta-virtualization (1.6.8).

commit.message:
[Onnx] Add SoftmaxCrossEntropyLoss (#8906)

* nll loss v1

* add converter

* decode strings in byte form

* decode variable length inputs

* make shapes correct

* unsqueeze

* proper weight handling

* simplify if statement

* fix tests

* add comment about tests

* delete extra file

* lint

* so cool

* Update CI Lint Image Version (#8841)

* Update CI Lint Image Version

* trigger

* [BUG] ToBasicBlockNormalForm immutability (#8778)

* ToBasicBlockNormalForm immutability

* better comment on ToBasicBlock

* refine comment of ToBasicBlockForm

* [GRAPH EXECUTOR,VM] Add benchmarking function to graph executor and vm (#8807)

* [GRAPH EXECUTOR,VM] Add benchmarking function to graph executor and vm

This new benchmarking function is just a convenience function for
calling time_evaluator on the underlying module. Hopefully this should
make it easier for users to get good benchmarks of their code.

* formatting

* import order

* more test, more comments, more precision

* fix tests

* add seconds descriptions to doc

* Apply CPPLint to CRT Tests (#8844)

This one was a bit trickier as there was more usage of dynamic arrays and less safe casts. I've tried to minimise the changes to just those required to passing linting.

* [Relay][TOPI] Support of depthwise conv2d NHWC for Mali/Bifrost. (#8584)

* [Relay][TOPI] Support of depthwise conv2d NHWC for Mali/Bifrost.

Added initial tunable autotvm templates for depthwise conv2d with
NHWC layout for Mali and Bifrost.

* [Relay][TOPI] Misc fixes for depthwise conv2d Mali/Bifrost.

- Fix assert for Bifrost.
- Set reasonable default axis splits to avoid using tophub for NHWC.
- Fixed typo: arm cpu -> Mali.

* [Relay][TOPI] Fixed formatting in depthwise conv2d Mali/Bifrost.

* Support for CMSIS-NN in Corstone300 Makefile (#8831)

Change-Id: Ifc2305db4e11d1d15d45407287f8f0bea469100a

* [microtvm][Zephyr] Increase timeout to fix flaky tests (#8846)

* increase timeout

* trigger

* [AMP] Bump up tolerance on flaky test (#8850)

* bumpy up tol

* bumped tolerance up even more

* jostle ci

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface (#8823)

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface

Make the tvm.target.hexagon() function take most options as keyword
parameters. This will allow adding additional parameters without changing
the interface.

No changes are required to existing code, except for changing positional
parameters following the CPU version to keyword parameters, and updating
the names of the keyword parameters:
  sim_args  -> sim_options,

If the graph returned from the callback consists of the original
pattern, the rewriter will run in the loop, which is not always desired.
So this patch proposes an option to run the rewriter only once.

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

Co-authored-by: Cahoon, Brendon <bcahoon@quicinc.com>

* [Graph Executor, VM] Add end to end benchmarking of models (#8858)

Add benchmarking that includes ovearhead of transfering inputs and
outputs to and from the device. This should give an accurate measurement
of the runtime a user would see when using the model. This is
accomplished by adding functions that run from inputs to return values
into the graph executor and the VM.

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin (#8532)

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin

Previously, pytest helper utilities such as automatic parametrization
of `target`/`dev`, or `tvm.testing.parameter` were only available for
tests within the `${TVM_HOME}/tests` directory.  This PR extracts the
helper utilities into an importable plugin, which can be used in
external tests (e.g. one-off debugging).

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface (#8823)

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface

Make the tvm.target.hexagon() function take most options as keyword
parameters. This will allow adding additional parameters without changing
the interface.

No changes are required to existing code, except for changing positional
parameters following the CPU version to keyword parameters, and updating
the names of the keyword parameters:
  sim_args  -> sim_options,
  llvm_args -> llvm_options,
although the old names will be accepted for the time being.

So this patch proposes an option to run the rewriter only once.

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface (#8823)

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface

Make the tvm.target.hexagon() function take most options as keyword
parameters. This will allow adding additional parameters without changing
the interface.

No changes are required to existing code, except for changing positional
parameters following the CPU version to keyword parameters, and updating
the names of the keyword parameters:
  sim_args  -> sim_options,
  llvm_args -> llvm_options,
although the old names will be accepted for the time being.

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once (#8843)

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once

If the graph returned from the callback consists of the original
pattern, the rewriter will run in the loop, which is not always desired.
So this patch proposes an option to run the rewriter only once.

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

Co-authored-by: Cahoon, Brendon <bcahoon@quicinc.com>

* [Graph Executor, VM] Add end to end benchmarking of models (#8858)

Add benchmarking that includes ovearhead of transfering inputs and
outputs to and from the device. This should give an accurate measurement
of the runtime a user would see when using the model. This is
accomplished by adding functions that run from inputs to return values
into the graph executor and the VM.

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin (#8532)

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin

Previously, pytest helper utilities such as automatic parametrization
of `target`/`dev`, or `tvm.testing.parameter` were only available for
tests within the `${TVM_HOME}/tests` directory.  This PR extracts the
helper utilities into an importable plugin, which can be used in
external tests (e.g. one-off debugging).

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

Co-authored-by: Cahoon, Brendon <bcahoon@quicinc.com>

* [Graph Executor, VM] Add end to end benchmarking of models (#8858)

Add benchmarking that includes ovearhead of transfering inputs and
outputs to and from the device. This should give an accurate measurement
of the runtime a user would see when using the model. This is
accomplished by adding functions that run from inputs to return values
into the graph executor and the VM.

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin (#8532)

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin

Previously, pytest helper utilities such as automatic parametrization
of `target`/`dev`, or `tvm.testing.parameter` were only available for
tests within the `${TVM_HOME}/tests` directory.  This PR extracts the
helper utilities into an importable plugin, which can be used in
external tests (e.g. one-off debugging).

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface (#8823)

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface

Make the tvm.target.hexagon() function take most options as keyword
parameters. This will allow adding additional parameters without changing
the interface.

No changes are required to existing code, except for changing positional
parameters following the CPU version to keyword parameters, and updating
the names of the keyword parameters:
  sim_args  -> sim_options,
  llvm_args -> llvm_options,
although the old names will be accepted for the time being.

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once (#8843)

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once

If the graph returned from the callback consists of the original
pattern, the rewriter will run in the loop, which is not always desired.
So this patch proposes an option to run the rewriter only once.

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

Co-authored-by: Cahoon, Brendon <bcahoon@quicinc.com>

* [Graph Executor, VM] Add end to end benchmarking of models (#8858)

Add benchmarking that includes ovearhead of transfering inputs and
outputs to and from the device. This should give an accurate measurement
of the runtime a user would see when using the model. This is
accomplished by adding functions that run from inputs to return values
into the graph executor and the VM.

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin (#8532)

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin

Previously, pytest helper utilities such as automatic parametrization
of `target`/`dev`, or `tvm.testing.parameter` were only available for
tests within the `${TVM_HOME}/tests` directory.  This PR extracts the
helper utilities into an importable plugin, which can be used in
external tests (e.g. one-off debugging).

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

Co-authored-by: Cahoon, Brendon <bcahoon@quicinc.com>

* [Graph Executor, VM] Add end to end benchmarking of models (#8858)

Add benchmarking that includes ovearhead of transfering inputs and
outputs to and from the device. This should give an accurate measurement
of the runtime a user would see when using the model. This is
accomplished by adding functions that run from inputs to return values
into the graph executor and the VM.

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin (#8532)

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin

Previously, pytest helper utilities such as automatic parametrization
of `target`/`dev`, or `tvm.testing.parameter` were only available for
tests within the `${TVM_HOME}/tests` directory.  This PR extracts the
helper utilities into an importable plugin, which can be used in
external tests (e.g. one-off debugging).

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

make it easier for users to get good benchmarks of their code.

Added initial tunable autotvm templates for depthwise conv2d with
NHWC layout for Mali and Bifrost.

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface (#8823)

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface

Make the tvm.target.hexagon() function take most options as keyword
parameters. This will allow adding additional parameters without changing
the interface.

No changes are required to existing code, except for changing positional
parameters following the CPU version to keyword parameters, and updating
the names of the keyword parameters:
  sim_args  -> sim_options,
  llvm_args -> llvm_options,
although the old names will be accepted for the time being.

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once (#8843)

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once

If the graph returned from the callback consists of the original
pattern, the rewriter will run in the loop, which is not always desired.
So this patch proposes an option to run the rewriter only once.

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

Co-authored-by: Cahoon, Brendon <bcahoon@quicinc.com>

* [Graph Executor, VM] Add end to end benchmarking of models (#8858)

Add benchmarking that includes ovearhead of transfering inputs and
outputs to and from the device. This should give an accurate measurement
of the runtime a user would see when using the model. This is
accomplished by adding functions that run from inputs to return values
into the graph executor and the VM.

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin (#8532)

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin

Previously, pytest helper utilities such as automatic parametrization
of `target`/`dev`, or `tvm.testing.parameter` were only available for
tests within the `${TVM_HOME}/tests` directory.  This PR extracts the
helper utilities into an importable plugin, which can be used in
external tests (e.g. one-off debugging).

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

Co-authored-by: Cahoon, Brendon <bcahoon@quicinc.com>

* [Graph Executor, VM] Add end to end benchmarking of models (#8858)

Add benchmarking that includes ovearhead of transfering inputs and
outputs to and from the device. This should give an accurate measurement
of the runtime a user would see when using the model. This is
accomplished by adding functions that run from inputs to return values
into the graph executor and the VM.

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin (#8532)

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin

Previously, pytest helper utilities such as automatic parametrization
of `target`/`dev`, or `tvm.testing.parameter` were only available for
tests within the `${TVM_HOME}/tests` directory.  This PR extracts the
helper utilities into an importable plugin, which can be used in
external tests (e.g. one-off debugging).

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface (#8823)

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface

Make the tvm.target.hexagon() function take most options as keyword
parameters. This will allow adding additional parameters without changing
the interface.

No changes are required to existing code, except for changing positional
parameters following the CPU version to keyword parameters, and updating
the names of the keyword parameters:
  sim_args  -> sim_options,
  llvm_args -> llvm_options,
although the old names will be accepted for the time being.

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once (#8843)

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once

If the graph returned from the callback consists of the original
pattern, the rewriter will run in the loop, which is not always desired.
So this patch proposes an option to run the rewriter only once.

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

Co-authored-by: Cahoon, Brendon <bcahoon@quicinc.com>

* [Graph Executor, VM] Add end to end benchmarking of models (#8858)

Add benchmarking that includes ovearhead of transfering inputs and
outputs to and from the device. This should give an accurate measurement
of the runtime a user would see when using the model. This is
accomplished by adding functions that run from inputs to return values
into the graph executor and the VM.

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin (#8532)

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin

Previously, pytest helper utilities such as automatic parametrization
of `target`/`dev`, or `tvm.testing.parameter` were only available for
tests within the `${TVM_HOME}/tests` directory.  This PR extracts the
helper utilities into an importable plugin, which can be used in
external tests (e.g. one-off debugging).

the interface.

No changes are required to existing code, except for changing positional
parameters following the CPU version to keyword parameters, and updating
the names of the keyword parameters:
  sim_args  -> sim_options,
  llvm_args -> llvm_options,
although the old names will be accepted for the time being.

* Rename 'args' to 'config' for clarity

* Use 'strip' instad of 'replace'

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once (#8843)

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once

If the graph returned from the callback consists of the original
pattern, the rewriter will run in the loop, which is not always desired.
So this patch proposes an option to run the rewriter only once.

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

Co-authored-by: Cahoon, Brendon <bcahoon@quicinc.com>

* [Graph Executor, VM] Add end to end benchmarking of models (#8858)

Add benchmarking that includes ovearhead of transfering inputs and
outputs to and from the device. This should give an accurate measurement
of the runtime a user would see when using the model. This is
accomplished by adding functions that run from inputs to return values
into the graph executor and the VM.

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin (#8532)

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin

Previously, pytest helper utilities such as automatic parametrization
of `target`/`dev`, or `tvm.testing.parameter` were only available for
tests within the `${TVM_HOME}/tests` directory.  This PR extracts the
helper utilities into an importable plugin, which can be used in
external tests (e.g. one-off debugging).

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface (#8823)

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface

Make the tvm.target.hexagon() function take most options as keyword
parameters. This will allow adding additional parameters without changing
the interface.

No changes are required to existing code, except for changing positional
parameters following the CPU version to keyword parameters, and updating
the names of the keyword parameters:
  sim_args  -> sim_options,
  llvm_args -> llvm_options,
although the old names will be accepted for the time being.

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once (#8843)

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once

If the graph returned from the callback consists of the original
pattern, the rewriter will run in the loop, which is not always desired.
So this patch proposes an option to run the rewriter only once.

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

Co-authored-by: Cahoon, Brendon <bcahoon@quicinc.com>

* [Graph Executor, VM] Add end to end benchmarking of models (#8858)

Add benchmarking that includes ovearhead of transfering inputs and
outputs to and from the device. This should give an accurate measurement
of the runtime a user would see when using the model. This is
accomplished by adding functions that run from inputs to return values
into the graph executor and the VM.

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin (#8532)

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin

Previously, pytest helper utilities such as automatic parametrization
of `target`/`dev`, or `tvm.testing.parameter` were only available for
tests within the `${TVM_HOME}/tests` directory.  This PR extracts the
helper utilities into an importable plugin, which can be used in
external tests (e.g. one-off debugging).

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface

Make the tvm.target.hexagon() function take most options as keyword
parameters. This will allow adding additional parameters without changing
the interface.

No changes are required to existing code, except for changing positional
parameters following the CPU version to keyword parameters, and updating
the names of the keyword parameters:
  sim_args  -> sim_options,
  llvm_args -> llvm_options,
although the old names will be accepted for the time being.

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once (#8843)

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once

If the graph returned from the callback consists of the original
pattern, the rewriter will run in the loop, which is not always desired.
So this patch proposes an option to run the rewriter only once.

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

Co-authored-by: Cahoon, Brendon <bcahoon@quicinc.com>

* [Graph Executor, VM] Add end to end benchmarking of models (#8858)

Add benchmarking that includes ovearhead of transfering inputs and
outputs to and from the device. This should give an accurate measurement
of the runtime a user would see when using the model. This is
accomplished by adding functions that run from inputs to return values
into the graph executor and the VM.

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin (#8532)

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin

Previously, pytest helper utilities such as automatic parametrization
of `target`/`dev`, or `tvm.testing.parameter` were only available for
tests within the `${TVM_HOME}/tests` directory.  This PR extracts the
helper utilities into an importable plugin, which can be used in
external tests (e.g. one-off debugging).

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

This new benchmarking function is just a convenience function for
calling time_evaluator on the underlying module. Hopefully this should
make it easier for users to get good benchmarks of their code.

This one was a bit trickier as there was more usage of dynamic arrays and less safe casts. I've tried to minimise the changes to just those required to passing linting.

* [Relay][TOPI] Support of depthwise conv2d NHWC for Mali/Bifrost. (#8584)

* [Relay][TOPI] Support of depthwise conv2d NHWC for Mali/Bifrost.

Added initial tunable autotvm templates for depthwise conv2d with
NHWC layout for Mali and Bifrost.

* [Relay][TOPI] Misc fixes for depthwise conv2d Mali/Bifrost.

- Fix assert for Bifrost.
- Set reasonable default axis splits to avoid using tophub for NHWC.
- Fixed typo: arm cpu -> Mali.

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface (#8823)

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface

Make the tvm.target.hexagon() function take most options as keyword
parameters. This will allow adding additional parameters without changing
the interface.

No changes are required to existing code, except for changing positional
parameters following the CPU version to keyword parameters, and updating
the names of the keyword parameters:
  sim_args  -> sim_options,
  llvm_args -> llvm_options,
although the old names will be accepted for the time being.

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once (#8843)

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once

If the graph returned from the callback consists of the original
pattern, the rewriter will run in the loop, which is not always desired.
So this patch proposes an option to run the rewriter only once.

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

Co-authored-by: Cahoon, Brendon <bcahoon@quicinc.com>

* [Graph Executor, VM] Add end to end benchmarking of models (#8858)

Add benchmarking that includes ovearhead of transfering inputs and
outputs to and from the device. This should give an accurate measurement
of the runtime a user would see when using the model. This is
accomplished by adding functions that run from inputs to return values
into the graph executor and the VM.

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin (#8532)

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin

Previously, pytest helper utilities such as automatic parametrization
of `target`/`dev`, or `tvm.testing.parameter` were only available for
tests within the `${TVM_HOME}/tests` directory.  This PR extracts the
helper utilities into an importable plugin, which can be used in
external tests (e.g. one-off debugging).

* [UnitTests] Refactor the plugin-specific logic out into plugin.py.

Make the tvm.target.hexagon() function take most options as keyword
parameters. This will allow adding additional parameters without changing
the interface.

No changes are required to existing code, except for changing positional
parameters following the CPU version to keyword parameters, and updating
the names of the keyword parameters:

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once

If the graph returned from the callback consists of the original
pattern, the rewriter will run in the loop, which is not always desired.
So this patch proposes an option to run the rewriter only once.

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

Co-authored-by: Cahoon, Brendon <bcahoon@quicinc.com>

* [Graph Executor, VM] Add end to end benchmarking of models (#8858)

Add benchmarking that includes ovearhead of transfering inputs and
outputs to and from the device. This should give an accurate measurement
of the runtime a user would see when using the model. This is
accomplished by adding functions that run from inputs to return values
into the graph executor and the VM.

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin (#8532)

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin

Previously, pytest helper utilities such as automatic parametrization
of `target`/`dev`, or `tvm.testing.parameter` were only available for
tests within the `${TVM_HOME}/tests` directory.  This PR extracts the
helper utilities into an importable plugin, which can be used in
external tests (e.g. one-off debugging).

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface (#8823)

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface

Make the tvm.target.hexagon() function take most options as keyword
parameters. This will allow adding additional parameters without changing
the interface.

No changes are required to existing code, except for changing positional
parameters following the CPU version to keyword parameters, and updating
the names of the keyword parameters:
  sim_args  -> sim_options,
  llvm_args -> llvm_options,
although the old names will be accepted for the time being.

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once (#8843)

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once

If the graph returned from the callback consists of the original
pattern, the rewriter will run in the loop, which is not always desired.
So this patch proposes an option to run the rewriter only once.

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

Co-authored-by: Cahoon, Brendon <bcahoon@quicinc.com>

* [Graph Executor, VM] Add end to end benchmarking of models (#8858)

Add benchmarking that includes ovearhead of transfering inputs and
outputs to and from the device. This should give an accurate measurement
of the runtime a user would see when using the model. This is
accomplished by adding functions that run from inputs to return values
into the graph executor and the VM.

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin (#8532)

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin

Previously, pytest helper utilities such as automatic parametrization
of `target`/`dev`, or `tvm.testing.parameter` were only available for
tests within the `${TVM_HOME}/tests` directory.  This PR extracts the
helper utilities into an importable plugin, which can be used in
external tests (e.g. one-off debugging).

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface

Make the tvm.target.hexagon() function take most options as keyword
parameters. This will allow adding additional parameters without changing
the interface.

No changes are required to existing code, except for changing positional
parameters following the CPU version to keyword parameters, and updating
the names of the keyword parameters:
  sim_args  -> sim_options,
  llvm_args -> llvm_options,
although the old names will be accepted for the time being.

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once (#8843)

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once

If the graph returned from the callback consists of the original
pattern, the rewriter will run in the loop, which is not always desired.
So this patch proposes an option to run the rewriter only once.

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

Co-authored-by: Cahoon, Brendon <bcahoon@quicinc.com>

* [Graph Executor, VM] Add end to end benchmarking of models (#8858)

Add benchmarking that includes ovearhead of transfering inputs and
outputs to and from the device. This should give an accurate measurement
of the runtime a user would see when using the model. This is
accomplished by adding functions that run from inputs to return values
into the graph executor and the VM.

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin (#8532)

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin

Previously, pytest helper utilities such as automatic parametrization
of `target`/`dev`, or `tvm.testing.parameter` were only available for
tests within the `${TVM_HOME}/tests` directory.  This PR extracts the
helper utilities into an importable plugin, which can be used in
external tests (e.g. one-off debugging).

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface (#8823)

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface

Make the tvm.target.hexagon() function take most options as keyword
parameters. This will allow adding additional parameters without changing
the interface.

No changes are required to existing code, except for changing positional
parameters following the CPU version to keyword parameters, and updating
the names of the keyword parameters:
  sim_args  -> sim_options,
  llvm_args -> llvm_options,
although the old names will be accepted for the time being.

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once (#8843)

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once

If the graph returned from the callback consists of the original
pattern, the rewriter will run in the loop, which is not always desired.
So this patch proposes an option to run the rewriter only once.

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

Co-authored-by: Cahoon, Brendon <bcahoon@quicinc.com>

* [Graph Executor, VM] Add end to end benchmarking of models (#8858)

Add benchmarking that includes ovearhead of transfering inputs and
outputs to and from the device. This should give an accurate measurement
of the runtime a user would see when using the model. This is
accomplished by adding functions that run from inputs to return values
into the graph executor and the VM.

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin (#8532)

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin

Previously, pytest helper utilities such as automatic parametrization
of `target`/`dev`, or `tvm.testing.parameter` were only available for
tests within the `${TVM_HOME}/tests` directory.  This PR extracts the
helper utilities into an importable plugin, which can be used in
external tests (e.g. one-off debugging).

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface

Make the tvm.target.hexagon() function take most options as keyword
parameters. This will allow adding additional parameters without changing
the interface.

No changes are required to existing code, except for changing positional
parameters following the CPU version to keyword parameters, and updating
the names of the keyword parameters:
  sim_args  -> sim_options,
  llvm_args -> llvm_options,
although the old names will be accepted for the time being.

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once (#8843)

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once

If the graph returned from the callback consists of the original
pattern, the rewriter will run in the loop, which is not always desired.
So this patch proposes an option to run the rewriter only once.

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

Co-authored-by: Cahoon, Brendon <bcahoon@quicinc.com>

* [Graph Executor, VM] Add end to end benchmarking of models (#8858)

Add benchmarking that includes ovearhead of transfering inputs and
outputs to and from the device. This should give an accurate measurement
of the runtime a user would see when using the model. This is
accomplished by adding functions that run from inputs to return values
into the graph executor and the VM.

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin (#8532)

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin

Previously, pytest helper utilities such as automatic parametrization
of `target`/`dev`, or `tvm.testing.parameter` were only available for
tests within the `${TVM_HOME}/tests` directory.  This PR extracts the
helper utilities into an importable plugin, which can be used in
external tests (e.g. one-off debugging).

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface (#8823)

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface

Make the tvm.target.hexagon() function take most options as keyword
parameters. This will allow adding additional parameters without changing
the interface.

No changes are required to existing code, except for changing positional
parameters following the CPU version to keyword parameters, and updating
the names of the keyword parameters:
  sim_args  -> sim_options,
  llvm_args -> llvm_options,
although the old names will be accepted for the time being.

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once (#8843)

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once

If the graph returned from the callback consists of the original
pattern, the rewriter will run in the loop, which is not always desired.
So this patch proposes an option to run the rewriter only once.

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

Co-authored-by: Cahoon, Brendon <bcahoon@quicinc.com>

* [Graph Executor, VM] Add end to end benchmarking of models (#8858)

Add benchmarking that includes ovearhead of transfering inputs and
outputs to and from the device. This should give an accurate measurement
of the runtime a user would see when using the model. This is
accomplished by adding functions that run from inputs to return values
into the graph executor and the VM.

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin (#8532)

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin

Previously, pytest helper utilities such as automatic parametrization
of `target`/`dev`, or `tvm.testing.parameter` were only available for
tests within the `${TVM_HOME}/tests` directory.  This PR extracts the
helper utilities into an importable plugin, which can be used in
external tests (e.g. one-off debugging).

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface (#8823)

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface

Make the tvm.target.hexagon() function take most options as keyword
parameters. This will allow adding additional parameters without changing
the interface.

No changes are required to existing code, except for changing positional
parameters following the CPU version to keyword parameters, and updating
the names of the keyword parameters:
  sim_args  -> sim_options,
  llvm_args -> llvm_options,
although the old names will be accepted for the time being.

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once (#8843)

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once

If the graph returned from the callback consists of the original
pattern, the rewriter will run in the loop, which is not always desired.
So this patch proposes an option to run the rewriter only once.

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

Co-authored-by: Cahoon, Brendon <bcahoon@quicinc.com>

* [Graph Executor, VM] Add end to end benchmarking of models (#8858)

Add benchmarking that includes ovearhead of transfering inputs and
outputs to and from the device. This should give an accurate measurement
of the runtime a user would see when using the model. This is
accomplished by adding functions that run from inputs to return values
into the graph executor and the VM.

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin (#8532)

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin

Previously, pytest helper utilities such as automatic parametrization
of `target`/`dev`, or `tvm.testing.parameter` were only available for
tests within the `${TVM_HOME}/tests` directory.  This PR extracts the
helper utilities into an importable plugin, which can be used in
external tests (e.g. one-off debugging).

CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface (#8823)

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface

Make the tvm.target.hexagon() function take most options as keyword
parameters. This will allow adding additional parameters without changing
the interface.

No changes are required to existing code, except for changing positional
parameters following the CPU version to keyword parameters, and updating
the names of the keyword parameters:
  sim_args  -> sim_options,
  llvm_args -> llvm_options,
although the old names will be accepted for the time being.

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once (#8843)

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once

If the graph returned from the callback consists of the original
pattern, the rewriter will run in the loop, which is not always desired.
So this patch proposes an option to run the rewriter only once.

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

Co-authored-by: Cahoon, Brendon <bcahoon@quicinc.com>

* [Graph Executor, VM] Add end to end benchmarking of models (#8858)

Add benchmarking that includes ovearhead of transfering inputs and
outputs to and from the device. This should give an accurate measurement
of the runtime a user would see when using the model. This is
accomplished by adding functions that run from inputs to return values
into the graph executor and the VM.

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin (#8532)

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin

Previously, pytest helper utilities such as automatic parametrization
of `target`/`dev`, or `tvm.testing.parameter` were only available for
tests within the `${TVM_HOME}/tests` directory.  This PR extracts the
helper utilities into an importable plugin, which can be used in
external tests (e.g. one-off debugging).

Make the tvm.target.hexagon() function take most options as keyword
parameters. This will allow adding additional parameters without changing
the interface.

No changes are required to existing code, except for changing positional
parameters following the CPU version to keyword parameters, and updating
the names of the keyword parameters:

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once

If the graph returned from the callback consists of the original
pattern, the rewriter will run in the loop, which is not always desired.
So this patch proposes an option to run the rewriter only once.

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

Co-authored-by: Cahoon, Brendon <bcahoon@quicinc.com>

* [Graph Executor, VM] Add end to end benchmarking of models (#8858)

Add benchmarking that includes ovearhead of transfering inputs and
outputs to and from the device. This should give an accurate measurement
of the runtime a user would see when using the model. This is
accomplished by adding functions that run from inputs to return values
into the graph executor and the VM.

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin (#8532)

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin

Previously, pytest helper utilities such as automatic parametrization
of `target`/`dev`, or `tvm.testing.parameter` were only available for
tests within the `${TVM_HOME}/tests` directory.  This PR extracts the
helper utilities into an importable plugin, which can be used in
external tests (e.g. one-off debugging).

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

This new benchmarking function is just a convenience function for
calling time_evaluator on the underlying module. Hopefully this should
make it easier for users to get good benchmarks of their code.

This one was a bit trickier as there was more usage of dynamic arrays and less safe casts. I've tried to minimise the changes to just those required to passing linting.

* [Relay][TOPI] Support of depthwise conv2d NHWC for Mali/Bifrost. (#8584)

* [Relay][TOPI] Support of depthwise conv2d NHWC for Mali/Bifrost.

Added initial tunable autotvm templates for depthwise conv2d with
NHWC layout for Mali and Bifrost.

* [Relay][TOPI] Misc fixes for depthwise conv2d Mali/Bifrost.

- Fix assert for Bifrost.
- Set reasonable default axis splits to avoid using tophub for NHWC.

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface (#8823)

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface

Make the tvm.target.hexagon() function take most options as keyword
parameters. This will allow adding additional parameters without changing
the interface.

No changes are required to existing code, except for changing positional
parameters following the CPU version to keyword parameters, and updating
the names of the keyword parameters:
  sim_args  -> sim_options,
  llvm_args -> llvm_options,
although the old names will be accepted for the time being.

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once (#8843)

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once

If the graph returned from the callback consists of the original
pattern, the rewriter will run in the loop, which is not always desired.
So this patch proposes an option to run the rewriter only once.

* [Hexagon] Change declaration order of unique_ptr objects to fix crash (#8859)

A crash occurs when automatically deleting an instance of
CodeGenHexagon because the LLVMContext object has already been
freed. Objects of both types are created using unique_ptr, but
the object managed by the LLVMContext unique_ptr is passed to
CodeGenHexagon object (not as a unique_ptr).

This crash is fixed by moving the declaration of the LLVMContext
object before the CodeGenHexagon object. I'm not sure if this
is the best way to fix this, but it does fix the crash. Also,
in other files, the LLVMContext object is always created first.

Co-authored-by: Cahoon, Brendon <bcahoon@quicinc.com>

* [Graph Executor, VM] Add end to end benchmarking of models (#8858)

Add benchmarking that includes ovearhead of transfering inputs and
outputs to and from the device. This should give an accurate measurement
of the runtime a user would see when using the model. This is
accomplished by adding functions that run from inputs to return values
into the graph executor and the VM.

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin (#8532)

* [UnitTests] Expose TVM pytest helpers as plugin

Previously, pytest helper utilities such as automatic parametrization
of `target`/`dev`, or `tvm.testing.parameter` were only available for
tests within the `${TVM_HOME}/tests` directory.  This PR extracts the
helper utilities into an importable plugin, which can be used in
external tests (e.g. one-off debugging).

* [UnitTests] Refactor the plugin-specific logic out into plugin.py.

* [Hexagon] Rework tvm.target.hexagon() interface

Make the tvm.target.hexagon() function take most options as keyword
parameters. This will allow adding additional parameters without changing
the interface.

No changes are required to existing code, except for changing positional
parameters following the CPU version to keyword parameters, and updating
the names of the keyword parameters:
  sim_args  -> sim_options,
  llvm_args -> llvm_options,
although the old names will be accepted for the time being.

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once (#8843)

* [Pattern matching] Add an option to rewrite the graph only once

If the graph returned from the callback consists of the original
pattern, the rewriter will run in the loop, which is not always desired.
So this patch proposes an option to run the rewriter only once.
